caption:
This photograph depicts a waterway heavily polluted with various kinds of debris and garbage. The scene includes a large amount of floating waste such as plastic bottles, plastic containers, a tire, pieces of wood, and miscellaneous trash scattered extensively across the water surface. In the foreground, prominently featured is a "NO DUMPING" sign, which stands as an ironic statement given the extensive pollution visible in the water.

In the middle of the waterway, there is a large pile of branches and natural debris, likely gathered there naturally by the water's flow, surrounded by various man-made objects. Several large items are visible, including barrels and a white appliance that resembles a washing machine or refrigerator.

The background shows dense greenery lining the riverbanks, indicating that this area might otherwise be a naturally beautiful setting if not for the pollution. The overall atmosphere of the photograph is somber and serves as a poignant commentary on environmental neglect and the consequences of improper waste disposal.
title: Lake Pontchartrain spills over onto illegal dumping ground. The lake is over full from heavy rains and water diverted from the flooding Mississippi River by the opening of the Bonnet Carre Spillway.
